alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 1:31PM EST until February 19 at 2:15PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EST FOR SULLIVAN...SOUTHERN WAYNE AND PIKE COUNTIES... At 131 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Grahamsville to Mountainhome, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 99 and 116. Interstate 84 between 17 and 53. Locations impacted include... Fallsburg, Bushkill, Monticello, Lackawaxen, Blooming Grove, Liberty, Bethel, Paupack, Neversink and South Fallsburg. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
